item.title: CF489B - BerSU Ball
item.description: CF489B - BerSU Ball Sort arrays $a, b$. Match $a[i], b[j]$ greedily with two pointers $i, j$. Assume $a[x], b[y]$ the first pair inconsistent with the optimal pair. Note that if $a[i^\prime], b[j^\prime]$ match, $b[j^\prime]$ is always the minimum $b[j]$ upon $a[i]$ not paired in array $b$.

item.title: CF381A - Sereja and Dima
item.description: CF381A - Sereja and Dima Let $x[n]$ be the cards and $l, r$ the left and right pointers. Sereja and Dima takes $\max(x[l], x[r])$ greedily each round then move the pointers.

item.title: CF489C - Given Length and Sum of Digits...
item.description: CF489C - Given Length and Sum of Digits… Let $x$ and $y$ be the maximum and mininum number with length $m$ and sum of digits $s$. Note that maximum sum of digits of length $m$ is $9m$ and if $s=0$, then there are no solutions with length $m>1$.
